data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Place your body forward and always look forward so you do not slip and slide. Always face forward and never backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the same as the point you started from. Turn around and turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take 6 steps to go around and 4 to start back at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot make it back to the beginning point if you already have the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn left - 2 steps = 2 steps. Turn left - 4 steps = 4 steps. Take 3 steps - 4 steps = 3 steps. Turn left - 5 steps = 4 steps. Take 3 steps - 4 steps = 2 steps. Turn around - 4 steps = 2 steps. Take 5 steps - 4 steps = 7 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The direction turns around then repeats the next 2 steps so you have 5 total steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn right twice, you go back to the beginning point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around before you take 6 steps, then you can only take 8 steps. If you take 2 steps between turning around, then you can only take 2 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You would take 6 steps forward to get to the starting point. When facing forward, you always face forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps and turn around. Take 7 steps and turn around. Take 3 steps and take two steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One does not always always face forward. One can take one step backward and 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, this is not a correct sequence. If you take 6 steps backward, you return to where you started. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can revert to your original location by moving forward and avoiding backward. You cannot step backward when crossing a line. You cannot return to whichever station you started in. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If the instructions say take 4 steps left and 3 steps forward, you would take four steps left before taking the next step. No, you would take 4 steps right before taking the next step. So, the answer is No.

When one is away from the starting point, they always take 3 steps backward. This indicates that they took 6 steps left which is their original step. The starting point is the place they originally started. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Taking the first two steps and turning around do not get you back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You can’ t take 10 steps and take 9 steps at the same time. So, the answer is No.

Take 10 steps back to the starting point. Each of the other instructions are the same. They just have different steps to go through. So, the answer is No.

If one takes only three steps there is no way one can return to the starting point. Adding 7 steps and turning around takes 10 steps and one takes ten steps to come back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The instructions are an example of how to work. The first step is the hardest as you move your body, and the last step will be the easiest. The first step is 8 steps left. The first step is the first opposite position in the direction of the initial direction. The second step is -7 steps right. The second step is -7 steps forward. The answer is No.

You can take 2 steps backward, take 3 steps backward or take 3 steps backward. If you took each of those steps backward, you would need to take 8 steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

No matter you face forward or backward, the first step matters. If you take 2 steps backward and 2 steps forward, you take 2 steps backward and 2 steps forward. You can never return to the starting point if you’re facing backward. For example, if you make your way up the stairs and get to the front, you could take 9 steps and then always go straight.
